result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Irvin R Magee-Cooper

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Irvin R Magee-Cooper in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Irvin R Magee-Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea Hearing. Defense requests the Court set Jury trial and final pretrial dates. Court sets the deadline of 1/6/2023 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms. Court Orders State to provide crime lab report prior to final pretrial hearing.  Matter adjourned to Br. 9. Final pre-trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am. Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Irvin R Magee-Cooper in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Irvin R Magee-Cooper.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing.  Defense advises a new offer was received from the State and requests additional time to review with the Defendant.  The Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Irvin R Magee-Cooper in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Annie Louk appeared for Attorney Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Defense request Plea hearing be scheduled. 
Case adjourned to Br. 9 for projected Plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Irvin R Magee-Cooper in court, appear by video with attorney Robert J Hampton, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Romeo.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Irvin R Magee-Cooper in court with attorney Robert J Hampton appear in person.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was not present. State witness on vacation.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Irvin R Magee-Cooper in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Irvin R Magee-Cooper in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Irvin R Magee-Cooper appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
